get.summary:
Fetch all backups in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- read:backups

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description: The identifier of the cluster (in Guid format).

parameters.name: scheduleId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the schedule (in Guid format).

TODO: ListOptions

delete.summary:
Deletes a backup in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- delete:backups

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: backupId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the backup (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

post.summary: Restores a backup in the account identified by the given ID.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: backupId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the backup (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the cluster (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

post.summary:
Creates a backup for the cluster identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- write:backups

parameters.name: backup.accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

id.description:
Unique identifier for the backup (in Guid format).
This is a read-only field and will be available after a backup is created.

createdAt.description:
The timestamp when the backup was created.
This is a read-only field and will be available after a backup is created.

clusterId.description:
The identifier of the cluster (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

name.description:
The name of the backup.
This is a read-only field and will be available after a backup is created.

scheduleId.description:
The identifier of the schedule that triggered the creation of the backup.
If there isn't value, that means the backup was created manually.
This is a read-only field and will be available after a backup is created.

status.description:
The current status of the backup.
This is a read-only field and will be set after CreateBackup is called.

deletedAt.description:
The timestamp when the backup was deleted (or when deletion started).
This is a read-only field and will be set after DeleteBackup is called.

creationDuration.description:
The total time taken to create the backup.
This is a read-only field and will be available after a backup is created.

BackupServiceCreateBackupBody.description: CreateBackupRequest is the request for the CreateBackup function.

This is a read-only field and will be available after a backup is created.

This is a required field.

name.description:

This is a read-only field and will be available after a backup is created.

scheduleId.description:
The identifier of the schedule that triggered the creation of the backup.
If there isn't value, that means the backup was created manually.
This is a read-only field and will be available after a backup is created.

status.description:

This is a read-only field and will be set after CreateBackup is called.

deletedAt.description:
The timestamp when the backup was deleted (or when deletion started).

creationDuration.description:

This is a read-only field and will be available after a backup is created.

v1Backup.description: A Backup represents a backup of a Qdrant database.

v1CreateBackupResponse.description: CreateBackupResponse is the response from the CreateBackup function.

v1DeleteBackupResponse.description:
DeleteBackupResponse is the response from the DeleteBackup function.

Empty

items.description: TODO: Add an operation timestamp the ListBackups is started, to support the `since` in ListOptions
items.title: The actual backups in this list

v1ListBackupsResponse.title: ListBackupsResponse is the response from the ListBackups function

v1RestoreBackupResponse.description:
RestoreBackupResponse is the response from the RestoreBackup function.

Empty
